awd_titl_txt: Paleoenvironments and Cenozoic Radiation of Tropical        American Vegetation
awd_abstract_narration: This research, with work completed earlier, will provide a detailed             analysis of the paleoecology of Cenozoic Central America using a                series of fossil beds that are extremely rich in pollen.  Cores                 will be sampled from each of two sites---one in southern Mexico and             one on Puerto Rico.  This study will complement data collected from             other sites in the Caribbean and Isthmus regions.  The data and the             derived inferences will have great implications for understanding               the effect of large-scale global change on the dynamics of                      vegetation, and the effects of those changes on animal populations              and climate itself.  Specifically, the results will be instrumental             in understanding the origin and migration of floras during the                  closure of the Pan-American land mass.  This event is crucial to                comprehending the modern floras and faunas of the New World, and it             has significance for biogeography, systematics, ecology, etc.
